Subject: [sfraves] NRR: SF Team Tibet ~ Board of Supervisors Meeting April 1st

SF Team Tibet ~ Board of Supervisors Meeting April 1st


http://sanfrancisco.tribe.net/event/1d8ebfe2-97da-491d-bc12-75ca9ecd803c

Date & Time: 2008-04-01 12:00 PM
Location: San Francisco City Hall  Room 250


Tibet Resolution Comes before the full San Francisco Board of
Supervisors on April 1.  Act now!

On March 27, 2008, Chris Daly's committee of the San Francisco Board
of Supervisors voted to approve the Resolution "Commending the Tibetan
Freedom Torch and the Human Rights Torch Relay."  The resolution is
highly critical of the Chinese government's human rights record in
Tibet, China, and the world.


Your call or email or online petition in the next 24 hours is critical!


1. Call or email each Supervisor individually, let them know you are a
Tibetan or a Tibet supporter, and ask  them to ?please support
Supervisor Chris Daly's Torch Resolution and please vote "no" to
Supervisor Carmen Chu's toothless torch resolution.? See contacts for
all supervisors below.


2. Send an online email petition to all the SF Supervisors, plus Mayor
Newsom, asking them to support the Tibetan human rights resolution:
http://www.ipetitions.com/petition/sft/


About the Tibetan Human Rights Resolution
This is a resolution commending the Tibetan Freedom Torch and the
Global Human Rights Torch Relay in their efforts to raise awareness
regarding human rights violations in China and urging the San
Francisco City Representatives accepting the Beijing 2008 Olympic
Torch to welcome the Torch in the explicit spirit of the Olympics,
consistent with the United Nations Charter established in this City,
and the United  Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The resolution would guide city policy in the following areas:

RESOLVED, The San Francisco Board of Supervisors urges our federal
representatives to call for an international inquiry to investigate
these recent atrocities and urges the Chinese government to allow
independent media in Tibet ; and be it

FURTHER RESOLVED, That the Board of Supervisors urges Mayor Gavin Newsom
to express his concern regarding the recent human rights atrocities
in Tibet when he hosts the Beijing Olympics torch in the City on April
8 and 9 and to urge the government of the People's Republic of China
to genuinely comply with the principles of tolerance and respect as
symbolized by the spirit behind the Olympic games; and, be it

FURTHER RESOLVED, That the Board of Supervisors urges Mayor Newsom to
provide full access to Tibetans and other human rights advocates to
protest the passing of the Olympic torch in San Francisco, and not to
limit their movement to such areas as
"First Amendment Areas"; and be it

FURTHER RESOLVED, That the Board of Supervisors urges the Olympic
Committee to boycott the Beijing 2008 Olympics Opening Ceremony if
there is no cessation of violence from Chinese security forces against
peaceful protestors and other critics of the Chinese government; and
be it

FURTHER RESOLVED, That the Board of Supervisors commend the efforts of
the Human Rights Torch Relay and the Tibetan Freedom Torch in raising
awareness about the human rights situation in China; and, be it

FURTHER RESOLVED,  That the San Francisco Board of Supervisors urges
the City's representative who will officially receive the 2008 Summer
Olympic Games Torch to welcome the Torch in the explicit spirit of
Olympism, consistent with the United Nations Charter established in
this City, and the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human
Rights; be it

FURTHER RESOLVED,  That the Board of Supervisors urges the above City
Official to also make publicly known that the 2008 Summer Olympic
Games Torch is received with alarm and protest at the failure of China
to meet its past solemn promises to the international community,
including the citizens of San Francisco, to cease the egregious and
ongoing human rights abuses in China and  occupied Tibet.

FURTHER RESOLVED,  That the Board of Supervisors urges our
representatives in the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives to
take an active role in supporting all efforts to stop human rights
violations in China and throughout the world.

3. Show up April 1 at 2 pm for the Board of Supervisors' meeting in
the main Supervisor's Chamber's, Rm 250, SFCity Hall. The Board of
Supervisors will have a full vote. 6 supervisors are needed to pass.

support of Tibetan Human Rights and Supervisor Daly's Tibetan Human
Rights Resolution.

Subject: [sfraves] Re: NRR: Economic Depression? Naw... (was Re: (nrr) QOD (Tue))

I like this video's take on the subject:
http://www.joketribe.com/video/Executive.Job.Market.In.2009.php

On 26 March 2008, pinkko wrote:

> There are a lot more reasons to lack faith in the current economy than to
> have faith in it. We're looking at the US moving from a manufacturing based
> economy to a service based economy. This is to say, instead of making
> things, we're seeing more and more people working in the service industry.
> Those jobs Bush loves to brag about making? Most of them are at places like
> Wal-Mart. The infrastructure of this country is rotting out from under our
> feet, and on top of it we're running out of oil.
>
> Things ain't lookin too good.
>
> Excellent point about growing your own veggies, though. The less you can
> come to rely on globalized infrastructure the better off you'll be when it
> starts to collapse.
>
> I myself would be FUCKED if the shit hit the fan tomorrow, since I almost
> always eat out and rarely even so much as buy groceries. I need to learn how
> to garden or something. FUCK.
>
> On Wed, Mar 26, 2008 at 8:26 AM, <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
>
>> I go on vacation for a couple of days and you guys have all the fun
>> without me?
>>
>> I'd say the probability of a serious economic depression in the United
>> States is actually pretty low, but of course not zero.  Be careful what you
>> wish for however.  Conspiracy fuckwads such as Jeff Rense are not a very
>> good source of information here.  Rense has been yelling "depression" at
>> everry economic downturn since he's been on the air. One almost imagines
>> he's wishing for it to happen.  I guess this is just another item on Rense's
>> extensive menu of fear and hate, but its also worth remembering that the
>> events of the Great Depression were triggered by a panic as well as an
>> actual economic event.
>>
>> Anyway most of these low budget analyses are flawed by failing to
>> understand the differences between the economic systems operating in the
>> 1920s and 30s as compared to what we see today.  There's the little detail
>> of unemployment remaining under 5% of course.  But you'll probably hear a
>> lot more about the differences in the regulatory regimes in the press.
>>  However the biggest difference IMO is global connectivity of economic
>> systems.  If a serious depression were to hit the U.S., would you really
>> be better off somewhere else?  Other than perhaps Europe, the answer is
>> probably no.
>>
>> To understand what I am talking about it is worth reviewing another news
>> story this week that got a lot less attention than the housing collapse and
>> resulting fiscal instability: Honduran cantelopes.  The FDA recently
>> announced that a number of people had been sickened by Salmonella
>> contaminaiton possibly resulting from eating cantelopes.  Fear of a drop in
>> demand for melons prompted the president of the Honduras to issue a
>> statement decrying the FDA's rash announcement. That is, even the threat of
>> a reduction in demand from the U.S., not even an actual reduction in
>> demand, was enough to prompt the leader of another nation to issue a public
>> statement.  That's a good indication of just how big our markets (and
>> supermarkets) are compared to the rest of the world.
>>
>> The truth is if that the U.S. entered a depression, the world economy as a
>> whole would probably collapse.  People would starve world wide and the U.S.
>> might very well see the least of it.  Consider the global effect of a sudden
>> and nearly complete drop in U.S. demand for consumer electronics for
>> example.
>>
>> As another example, consider the cost of the war in Iraq.  We've all taken
>> on a significant debt as the result of the Bush administration's war in
>> Iraq.  But its worth asking where exactly we borrowed this much money?  The
>> answer is in large part China.  China opposed the Iraq war in the U.N. and
>> in their public statements but at the same time loaned the U.S. the money
>> to fight the war in the first place.  It is unclear we even could have
>> fought the war without these loans.  Not everything is as it appears in
>> U.S. Today perhaps.
>>
>> And if the U.S. where to default on these loans, who'd be worse off the
>> U.S. or China?  I think that this is quite unclear and therefore its
>> simply not going to be allowed to happen by either party.  Its a new more
>> evolved form of Mutually Assured Destruction.
>>
>> Finally, in conclusion, listen to what Philip has to say here about
>> preparing yourself somehow because if you are all correct about the future
>> of our economy simply whining about it on the Internets won't be of much use
>> to you.
>>
>> Best,
>>
>> Peter
>>
>> PS
>>

On Tue, 1 Apr 2008 dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote:
-&e->Mostly before my time despite my age, but I did go to one Wicked full 
-&e->moon at Boony Doon beach before I had even heard the term "rave"...
-&e->
-&e->How many remember the nasty ass bathroom at the original DNA?  

Your sense of nostalgia has some horrible triggers.  And for the record, 
the winner of nasty bathrooms was San Jose's the Cactus Club.  I took a 
coworker there one night cause his business trip to SF coincided with my 
club night there... and he ended up throwing away his shoes AND EXPENSING 
THEM cause he'd stepped in about an inch of urine/etc and wouldn't pack 
them back up in his suitcase.

-&e->How about Mondo 2000 magazine?

:( I miss that kind of press.  Genuinely weird shit!  UFOs, Genesis P. 
Orridge, entheogens and musings on unlocking the cybernetic potential!  
Of course our b-rave new world gave way to a reality that most could 
comfortably say fell short by most counts...

-&e->And BTW Brian B. played Saturday!

So did Chris Jackson, who played the Sharon parties under the name Darwin 
as a teenager.  I played as well, but I only date back to a noobish '96 DJ 
vintage.

Monty has long gone off list, but I know how to find him (he's still DJing 
and from time to time updates a great music blog).

We need to throw some shindig when Niels, JSL, Black Adder, Monty, 
LeslieA, BrianB, GeoffW and all the old eloquent SFR flame posse can throw 
down (to the onlookers, there was a time when there were like 15 people on 
SFR who could write for pages and pages without fatigue... good if you 
liked to read opinions from people you might not meet otherwise, bad if 
you had a slow connection).

andyw - mutorsoundsystem - saturn5.com/andy

To: SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <Pine.LNX.4.62.0804011045140.7363@atari>
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.62.0804011118580.7363@atari>
References: <67232.3248.qm@web32404.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
 <Pine.LNX.4.62.0804011045140.7363@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] McCain to Campaign at Burning Man Festival


http://www.burningman.com/news/080401_mccain.html

McCAIN TO CAMPAIGN AT BURNING MAN

Phoenix, AZ -- Senator and presumptive Republican Presidential nominee 
John McCain has rocked the political world by announcing his intention to 
bring his campaign to Nevada's Black Rock Desert this summer, during the 
counter-cultural art event known as Burning Man. 

"While our opponents would callously ignore them, this proud American 
believes that even temporary cities deserve the attention of the President 
of the United States," said McCain senior staffer Mark Dosenberner. "We 
are proud that Black Rock City will be a stop on the 'Straight Talk 
Express' tour this summer."

mccainCiting the compatibility of the Burning Man festival's "American 
Dream" art theme with his campaign's message of a bigger, stronger, 
somewhat-taller America, McCain hopes to reach out to the thousands of 
"Burners" who gather in the desert for this 7-day celebration of radical 
self-expression, radical self-reliance, community and art. "I look forward 
to engaging with the good folks of Black Rock City, and showing them not 
just by my words, but through my actions that deep down, despite all our 
glaringly stark differences, we share the same American Dream. No, 
seriously," said McCain, "... what's so funny? Did I make a joke?"

The candidate's research team has been briefing the Senator on the ways of 
the Burning Man participant, ensuring that McCain, renowned for his 
ability to "cut loose", will not be perceived as a so-called "newbie" or 
"yahoo", which could shatter his chances of garnering votes at this famed 
desert bacchanalia. straight talk expressMcCain's transportation team is 
working with his AV crew to retrofit the Senator's "Straight Talk Express" 
bus to accommodate the largest state-of-the-art speaker stacks ever seen 
at Burning Man, and will be parking the bus on the 2:00 radial street with 
other sound camps. "We're putting in a set of Technics SL-1200 turntables 
on the roof, and recruiting the hottest international Republican DJ's to 
work the wheels of steel," said Dosenberner. "The Senator looks forward to 
personally making grilled cheese sandwiches for revelers 'rolling in' from 
surrounding raves each night, and maybe taking a turn on the decks himself 
... you should expect some slammin' big band favorites, should that 
happen."

"We're in this race to win," said McCain, a decorated war veteran, "and if 
it takes coming out to a place like Burning Man, and mixing with ... these 
... people ... to do it, well ... I figure I've been held captive in a 
North Vietnamese POW camp ... how bad could this really be?"

black rock desertMcCain's campaign will be sending an advance team to 
ensure all necessary security measures are in place prior to the Senator's 
arrival. The team will visit the playa in May to thoroughly scour the vast 
desert expanse, searching for potential security risks. "The playa may be 
flat, but it certainly isn't without its dangers ... Americans know full 
well that terrorists are after each and every one of us ... and don't be 
fooled: expansive, desolate places like the Black Rock Desert are as much 
a target as our homes, schools, churches, malls and SUV's. We must stay 
vigilant at all times," said Dosenberner. 

The Burning Man Project has been fully cooperating with the McCain 
campaign, ensuring that every possible security step will be taken to 
ensure the Senator's safety while in Black Rock City.  "Let's see ... I 
think we've got some caution tape around here somewhere," said Burning Man 
founder Larry Harvey.  "Oh yeah, here it is."

----

Feliz 4.1.08 Kids!
andyw

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

>>AndyW <andy@saturn5.com> wrote:
>>http://www.burningman.com/news/080401_mccain.html
>>
>>McCAIN TO CAMPAIGN AT BURNING MAN
>>
>>Phoenix, AZ -- Senator and presumptive Republican Presidential nominee
>>John McCain has rocked the political world by announcing his intention to
>>bring his campaign to Nevada's Black Rock Desert this summer, during the
>>counter-cultural art event known as Burning Man.
>>
>>"While our opponents would callously ignore them, this proud American
>>believes that even temporary cities deserve the attention of the President
>>of the United States," said McCain senior staffer Mark Dosenberner. "We
>>are proud that Black Rock City will be a stop on the 'Straight Talk
>>Express' tour this summer."
>>
>>mccainCiting the compatibility of the Burning Man festival's "American
>>Dream" art theme with his campaign's message of a bigger, stronger,
>>somewhat-taller America, McCain hopes to reach out to the thousands of
>>"Burners" who gather in the desert for this 7-day celebration of radical
>>self-expression, radical self-reliance, community and art. "I look forward
>>to engaging with the good folks of Black Rock City, and showing them not
>>just by my words, but through my actions that deep down, despite all our
>>glaringly stark differences, we share the same American Dream. No,
>>seriously," said McCain, "... what's so funny? Did I make a joke?"
>>
>>The candidate's research team has been briefing the Senator on the ways of
>>the Burning Man participant, ensuring that McCain, renowned for his
>>ability to "cut loose", will not be perceived as a so-called "newbie" or
>>"yahoo", which could shatter his chances of garnering votes at this famed
>>desert bacchanalia. straight talk expressMcCain's transportation team is
>>working with his AV crew to retrofit the Senator's "Straight Talk Express"
>>bus to accommodate the largest state-of-the-art speaker stacks ever seen
>>at Burning Man, and will be parking the bus on the 2:00 radial street with
>>other sound camps. "We're putting in a set of Technics SL-1200 turntables
>>on the roof, and recruiting the hottest international Republican DJ's to
>>work the wheels of steel," said Dosenberner. "The Senator looks forward to
>>personally making grilled cheese sandwiches for revelers 'rolling in' from
>>surrounding raves each night, and maybe taking a turn on the decks himself
>>... you should expect some slammin' big band favorites, should that
>>happen."
>>
>>"We're in this race to win," said McCain, a decorated war veteran, "and if
>>it takes coming out to a place like Burning Man, and mixing with ... these
>>... people ... to do it, well ... I figure I've been held captive in a
>>North Vietnamese POW camp ... how bad could this really be?"
>>
>>black rock desertMcCain's campaign will be sending an advance team to
>>ensure all necessary security measures are in place prior to the Senator's
>>arrival. The team will visit the playa in May to thoroughly scour the vast
>>desert expanse, searching for potential security risks. "The playa may be
>>flat, but it certainly isn't without its dangers ... Americans know full
>>well that terrorists are after each and every one of us ... and don't be
>>fooled: expansive, desolate places like the Black Rock Desert are as much
>>a target as our homes, schools, churches, malls and SUV's. We must stay
>>vigilant at all times," said Dosenberner.
>>
>>The Burning Man Project has been fully cooperating with the McCain
>>campaign, ensuring that every possible security step will be taken to
>>ensure the Senator's safety while in Black Rock City.  "Let's see ... I
>>think we've got some caution tape around here somewhere," said Burning Man
>>founder Larry Harvey.  "Oh yeah, here it is."
>>

Subject: [sfraves] bsp: The dark and twisted sound of the Berlin underground...Saturday @ [KONTROL]

Download the sets below for a taste of what you're in for!

This will be one of only two post-WMC dates in the US.

_______________________________________________



Saturday, April 5th, 2008


[ K O N T R O L ]


minimal techno + avant-house
every 1st Saturday @ The Endup



featuring from Berlin, Germany:


PAN-POT  ( Mobilee . Einmaleins Musik . Clink . CMYK )

>From the heart of the Berlin underground, Mobilee's
white-hot DJ/production duo Pan-Pot finally grace the
[KONTROL] decks with an extended 3 hour set of late
night dancefloor dementia. Having recently been chosen
to release the inaugural full length artist album on
Mobilee, "Pan-O-Rama", as well as being nominated for
"Best Minimal Artist" in the 2008 Beatport Awards,
this is your chance to hear firsthand what all the
fuss is about.  Prepare for a night of deep, dark,
surgically precise beats that will have your feet
moving and your head swimming.



plus special guest:


CLINT STEWART  ( Auralism Records . Nightlight Music )

In the last year Auralism assistant label manager
Clint Stewart has transformed before our eyes from
an enthusiastic new face on the scene to a tried and
true staple of SF's burgeoning techno community.
Bear witness to his prodigious talent with a highly
anticipated set in which Clint promises to "beat it
like a red-headed stepchild!"



with [KONTROL] residents:


ALLAND BYALLO  ( Leibe*Detail . Nightlight Music )
NIKOLA BAYTALA  ( Robsoul . S.W.A.T. )
SAMMY D  ( Dirtybird . Utensil )
CRAIG KUNA  ( Platform . ESDJCO )


________________________________________________


The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

FREE until 11pm!

________________________________________________


Full bios, pics and FREE music:
http://www.kontrolsf.com

[KONTROL] on MySpace:

http://www.kontrolsf.com/K34/K34H.jpg

Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K34/K34P.jpg


________________________________________________


PAN-POT

A pan-pot is a simple, workaday knob, given to side-to-side
flip-flopping and not much else. Pan-Pot, on the other hand, are a
brilliantly multidimensional Berlin duo currently twisting house and
techno fans into rapturous fits.

In just a few short years, Pan-Pot--the duo comprised of Tassilo
Ippenberger and Thomas Benedix=97-have become a central presence in
electronic dance music's most advanced sectors. Their rise parallels
that of their home label, Anja Schneider's Mobilee, coming at a time
when established categories are breaking down and accepted notions of
"minimal" (please) are giving way to an unprecedented degree of
dynamism on demanding dancefloors.

Pan-Pot's vinyl debut came in May 2005 with the Popy & Caste EP
(mobilee002), featuring two cuts bursting with gritty, dirty funk, as
though they'd scraped all the gunk from beneath the knobs of their
gear, packed it into a ball and sent it rolling across the nightclub.
Since then, in addition to their contribution to the Extra EP
(mobilee005 plus), backing Daniel Stefanik's anthemic banger "The
Bells," they've released three more EPs on Mobilee (Obscenity,
mobilee005; Black Lodge, mobilee012; and What Is What, mobilee023) and
two on Einmaleins Musik. Their kinetic, undulating grooves have proved
particularly tempting to other producers=97-Jesse Rose, Lee Van Dowski,
Agn=E8s, Barem and Camea have all taken (pot)shots at reworking the
group's tunes=97-and their own remixing skills are increasingly in
demand: Pan- Pot have put their immediately recognizable spin on
tracks by Misc., Anja Schneider & Sebo K, Tim Xavier, Dapayk Solo,
Sweet 'n Candy, and Dami=E1n Schwartz, among others.

The release of their debut album marks yet another milestone for the
group. Appropriately titled Pan-O-Rama, the record=97-which has the
honor of being the first artist album released on Mobilee=97-offers a
360-degree tour of techno at its most twisted, balancing ominous
atmospherics with an unusual lightness of touch, and running classic
machine music through silicon's digital wringer.

They may name themselves after a piece of gear, but Pan-Pot's music is
ultimately about moving bodies, not knobs. Both live and as DJs,
Pan-Pot deliver on that promise with sets that rope together crisply
minimal, coolly restrained techno and hot and heavy house. Anyone
who's ever played with an analog synthesizer knows that all those pots
and dials are there to be touched; Pan-Pot reaches out and touches
right back=97with a love slap from the heart of the Berlin underground.


----> LINKS:

Mobilee Website:
http://mobilee-records.de/pan-pot

Pan-Pot on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/panpot

Pan-Pot's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Pan-Pot

Recent article on Pan-Pot:
http://weeklydig.com/arts-entertainment/music/200803/pan-pot

Pan-Pot - Live @ Amnesia, Spain 2007
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DGFZ7JX6puL8


_______________________________________________


CLINT STEWART

In a sea of heads, Clint Stewart can't contain his enthusiasm. "It's
an amazing time for dance music," says the Auralism assistant label
manager. "There's so much good music and an endless list of people
making it. It's inspiring." The Florida-born DJ / producer / promoter
is true to his word, commanding crowds with ease and producing sexy,
gauzy cuts that exhort everyone to dance.

Growing up in a home surrounded by the sounds of classical music to
classic rock and early blues, he began training in classical piano and
guitar. Over time Stewart's adolescent obsession with punk's passion
and aggression ("I hated dance music") led to a college-age awakening
to techno's dark, relentless groove. A stint on UNF College Radio
Station gave him the opportunity to start Nocturnal Underground radio
show where he met Marc Smith. After college he moved to Miami and
began eventually joining forces with Auralism co-founders Marc Smith
and Jason Short and playing at their residency at Jazid. Within the
year, Stewart moved to Hawaii for a brief stint to "get away", but was
soon living in San Francisco after a gig in which he never stepped
foot on his return flight.

Since joining the Auralism camp, Stewart has been "going 100 miles an
hour, all day, every day," playing high-profile DJ gigs with top
artists among as well as a particularly sizzling set at SF's annual
LoveFest. In addition pounding the pavement for Auralism, Stewart has
a growing list of productions out there, including a pair of ecstatic
remixes for the label's inaugural Aural Therapy 1.1 compilation.
That's a lot of work for a short time in a new town, but master
multi-tasker Stewart's just getting started.


----> LINKS:

Auralism Website:
http://www.auralismrecords.com/

Clint on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/clintstewartsounds


----> AUDIO:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DQDtTb4FSu3I

after sundown - 2nite in the VOID..

that we recover the treasures of life.
Where you stumble,
there lies your treasure." [Joseph Campbell]

and down into our own musical abyss - the Void - is where we=92ll be =
headed
after sundown this Tuesday, for a special spontaneous selection of late
night musical treasures - stark, dark, delicious and wild..!

9pm Tuesday April 1st [no kidding]..

go to 90hz.org to listen and chat. And the chat=92s been rockin=92 the =
last
couple of weeks, so I=92ll do my best to drop in as often as I can =
during this
show..

Subject: [sfraves] John Digweed - Transitions Volume 4

--0-471932770-1207091861=:77892
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

[official release date: 14 April 2008]
 
 i know it's not formally out yet, but i have to post a preemptive "fuck yeah" for this mix. are we allowed to post unauthorized links to mixes on this list? either way, it is currently floating around online and it's worth seeking out.
 
 i'll admit that diggers hasn't really been doing it for me lately. i know he's got a gaggle of rabid fans out there who believe he can do no wrong, but i remember listening to the sasha and digweed set from bonnaroo 2007 and then promptly forgetting it. this mix is something special though. the layers are engaging and complex, as digweed often has three tracks playing simultaneously. there's a little something for everyone here: moments of feather-light trance, fist-pumping, driving progressive, electro undercurrents, and enough subtle twists to make even the most sober listeners second guess the contents of their coffee. 
 
 here's the published tracklist, though i think it's actually a bit more complicated than this:
 
 01. Julien Parise - A5B (Mirko Remix)   
 02. Henry Saiz/Guy J - From Empty Lands/Geko  
 03. Jeff Bennett/Kabale und Liebe + Daniel Sanchez - In Spite/Mumbling Yeah (Loco Dice Tribute Remix)  
 04. Nightguy/Henry Saiz/Myers Briggs - Pretty Face/From Tangled Seas/Forever   
 05. Sian/Kim Runic/Two Lone Swordsmen - Wear Your Scars Like Medals/Suspicious Blue/Shack 54 (Jet Project remix)  
 06. Plasmik/Jamie Stevens - Pitch It/Keep Her Space (Claude VonStroke Remix/Smith + Selway's Control Mix)  
 07. Jerome Sydenham + Tiger Stripes/Guy J - Elevation/Under Pressure (Ink + Needle Remix)   
 08. Pascal Feos + Marc Mirror/Spector/Jrg Burger - Rezolution/Mineral Drive/Superpicture (Jamie Stevens Remix)   
 09. Pig + Dan/Emmanuel - Dreams of Bells/Parade (Original Mix)   
 10. Soliquid - Piknic Bugz (Original Mix/Gone Wild Mix)
 
 seriously, it's a fantastic mix. check it out!

love,
mo


*bliss does not require ignorance*

You rock. That's why Blockbuster's offering you one month of Blockbuster Total Access, No Cost.
--0-471932770-1207091861=:77892--

e and> techno fans into rapturous fits.> > In just a few short years, Pan-P=

of> dynamism on demanding dancefloors.> > Pan-Pot's vinyl debut came in May=

ith gritty, dirty funk, as> though they'd scraped all the gunk from beneath=

ea have all taken (pot)shots at reworking the> group's tunes=97-and their o=

of being the first artist album released on Mobilee=97-offers a> 360-degree=

n unusual lightness of touch, and running classic> machine music through si=
licon's digital wringer.> > They may name themselves after a piece of gear,=

ve and as DJs,> Pan-Pot deliver on that promise with sets that rope togethe=
r crisply> minimal, coolly restrained techno and hot and heavy house. Anyon=
e> who's ever played with an analog synthesizer knows that all those pots> =
and dials are there to be touched; Pan-Pot reaches out and touches> right b=

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "mo corleone" <mo_corleone2@yahoo.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, April 01, 2008 4:17 PM
Subject: [sfraves] John Digweed - Transitions Volume 4


> [official release date: 14 April 2008]
>
> i know it's not formally out yet, but i have to post a preemptive "fuck 
> yeah" for this mix. are we allowed to post unauthorized links to mixes on 
> this list? either way, it is currently floating around online and it's 
> worth seeking out.
>
> i'll admit that diggers hasn't really been doing it for me lately. i know 
> he's got a gaggle of rabid fans out there who believe he can do no wrong, 
> but i remember listening to the sasha and digweed set from bonnaroo 2007 
> and then promptly forgetting it. this mix is something special though. the 
> layers are engaging and complex, as digweed often has three tracks playing 
> simultaneously. there's a little something for everyone here: moments of 
> feather-light trance, fist-pumping, driving progressive, electro 
> undercurrents, and enough subtle twists to make even the most sober 
> listeners second guess the contents of their coffee.
>
> here's the published tracklist, though i think it's actually a bit more 
> complicated than this:
>
> 01. Julien Parise - A5B (Mirko Remix)
> 02. Henry Saiz/Guy J - From Empty Lands/Geko
> 03. Jeff Bennett/Kabale und Liebe + Daniel Sanchez - In Spite/Mumbling 
> Yeah (Loco Dice Tribute Remix)
> 04. Nightguy/Henry Saiz/Myers Briggs - Pretty Face/From Tangled 
> Seas/Forever
> 05. Sian/Kim Runic/Two Lone Swordsmen - Wear Your Scars Like 
> Medals/Suspicious Blue/Shack 54 (Jet Project remix)
> 06. Plasmik/Jamie Stevens - Pitch It/Keep Her Space (Claude VonStroke 
> Remix/Smith + Selway's Control Mix)
> 07. Jerome Sydenham + Tiger Stripes/Guy J - Elevation/Under Pressure (Ink 
> + Needle Remix)
> 08. Pascal Feos + Marc Mirror/Spector/Jrg Burger - Rezolution/Mineral 
> Drive/Superpicture (Jamie Stevens Remix)
> 09. Pig + Dan/Emmanuel - Dreams of Bells/Parade (Original Mix)
> 10. Soliquid - Piknic Bugz (Original Mix/Gone Wild Mix)
>
> seriously, it's a fantastic mix. check it out!
>
> love,
> mo
>
>
> *bliss does not require ignorance*
>
> ---------------------------------
> You rock. That's why Blockbuster's offering you one month of Blockbuster 
> Total Access, No Cost.

have any suggestions or ideas? I have no degree or credentials, but I am a
fast learner, good with people, and have a pretty huge knowledge of most

years. I travel and play shows quite frequently, so I am looking for
something flexible and part-time, preferably nothing too soul-sucking or
degrading.  I live in Alameda and can get to BART, but don't have a car. Any
ideas?

>>>seriously...is the an april fools joke or something
>>>
>>>AndyW <andy@saturn5.com> wrote:
>>>http://www.burningman.com/news/080401_mccain.html
>>>
>>>McCAIN TO CAMPAIGN AT BURNING MAN
>>>
>>>Phoenix, AZ -- Senator and presumptive Republican Presidential nominee
>>>John McCain has rocked the political world by announcing his intention to
>>>bring his campaign to Nevada's Black Rock Desert this summer, during the
>>>counter-cultural art event known as Burning Man.
>>>
>>>"While our opponents would callously ignore them, this proud American
>>>believes that even temporary cities deserve the attention of the 
>>>President
>>>of the United States," said McCain senior staffer Mark Dosenberner. "We
>>>are proud that Black Rock City will be a stop on the 'Straight Talk
>>>Express' tour this summer."
>>>
>>>mccainCiting the compatibility of the Burning Man festival's "American
>>>Dream" art theme with his campaign's message of a bigger, stronger,
>>>somewhat-taller America, McCain hopes to reach out to the thousands of
>>>"Burners" who gather in the desert for this 7-day celebration of radical
>>>self-expression, radical self-reliance, community and art. "I look 
>>>forward
>>>to engaging with the good folks of Black Rock City, and showing them not
>>>just by my words, but through my actions that deep down, despite all our
>>>glaringly stark differences, we share the same American Dream. No,
>>>seriously," said McCain, "... what's so funny? Did I make a joke?"
>>>
>>>The candidate's research team has been briefing the Senator on the ways 
>>>of
>>>the Burning Man participant, ensuring that McCain, renowned for his
>>>ability to "cut loose", will not be perceived as a so-called "newbie" or
>>>"yahoo", which could shatter his chances of garnering votes at this famed
>>>desert bacchanalia. straight talk expressMcCain's transportation team is
>>>working with his AV crew to retrofit the Senator's "Straight Talk 
>>>Express"
>>>bus to accommodate the largest state-of-the-art speaker stacks ever seen
>>>at Burning Man, and will be parking the bus on the 2:00 radial street 
>>>with
>>>other sound camps. "We're putting in a set of Technics SL-1200 turntables
>>>on the roof, and recruiting the hottest international Republican DJ's to
>>>work the wheels of steel," said Dosenberner. "The Senator looks forward 
>>>to
>>>personally making grilled cheese sandwiches for revelers 'rolling in' 
>>>from
>>>surrounding raves each night, and maybe taking a turn on the decks 
>>>himself
>>>... you should expect some slammin' big band favorites, should that
>>>happen."
>>>
>>>"We're in this race to win," said McCain, a decorated war veteran, "and 
>>>if
>>>it takes coming out to a place like Burning Man, and mixing with ... 
>>>these
>>>... people ... to do it, well ... I figure I've been held captive in a
>>>North Vietnamese POW camp ... how bad could this really be?"
>>>
>>>black rock desertMcCain's campaign will be sending an advance team to
>>>ensure all necessary security measures are in place prior to the 
>>>Senator's
>>>arrival. The team will visit the playa in May to thoroughly scour the 
>>>vast
>>>desert expanse, searching for potential security risks. "The playa may be
>>>flat, but it certainly isn't without its dangers ... Americans know full
>>>well that terrorists are after each and every one of us ... and don't be
>>>fooled: expansive, desolate places like the Black Rock Desert are as much
>>>a target as our homes, schools, churches, malls and SUV's. We must stay
>>>vigilant at all times," said Dosenberner.
>>>
>>>The Burning Man Project has been fully cooperating with the McCain
>>>campaign, ensuring that every possible security step will be taken to
>>>ensure the Senator's safety while in Black Rock City.  "Let's see ... I
>>>think we've got some caution tape around here somewhere," said Burning 
>>>Man
>>>founder Larry Harvey.  "Oh yeah, here it is."
>>>

coming soon:  Sure Dragn'fly is gay - but she
is celibate - virginal, in fact - pure as the driven snow

I know I can get lack on my email but 4 days ain't typical for this list....
Turns out I wasn't just sick with the flu when I finally hit Moksha Saturday 
night and just got out of surgery early today.  Doh!  So I guess my joke 
about dying around my friends wasn't so much a joke (not that the odds would 
have actually favored me dying, but internal bleeding ain't no joke).  Lucky 
I decided to cave in and go to the doc when I didn't feel so good on Monday! 
wow!

Aside from that, if you had put me out there as virginal and pure as the 
driven snow, well I'd have to say that is not a joke either.

LOL

I missed you on Saturday daw'lin!  I"m gonna be back down for some intimate 
"club-like" gigs in April.  Do I need to arrange for your kidnapping to kick 
it with you? I can and will if I have to!

....::::Friday, April 11th, 2008::::....

*Blissed Out* ::: A Benefit party for Bliss Factory Studios!

Bliss Factory Studios in Alameda, homebase for DEF, Radio Integrated,
Easystreet, Chel-C Faith and Sean Ocean, is seeking your help. We've got an
eviction notice on our door and are raising some funds in the best way we
know how... throwing a kick ass party! Come raise the roof to help us keep
one over our heads. ;)

Featuring music from our wonderful friends:

Alex Windsor (Friends & Family) :::: Techno
Andy W (Resource Records, Friends & Family) :::: Techno - *All Hardware Live
P.A.*
Caltrop (Tokyo Electric) :::: Acid House/Disco
Disconnect (DEF, Bliss Factory) :::: Techno
Easystreet (myspace.com/sexyeasystreet) :::: Italo Disco/Electro Pop -
*Live*
Forest Green (ForestGreen.org <http://www.ForestGreen.org>, Daly City
Records, Cute Fang Recordings) :::: Techno
M.O.D. (Evil Breaks) :::: Progressive House/Breaks
Razvan (Black Market Techno) :::: Techno/Minimal
Toro Toro (Friends & Family) :::: Tech-House


Plus....

*Bake Sale by Miss Chelsea Faith
*Raver Garage Sale (so don't forget to tuck a few extra dollars in the stash
pocket of your UFOs!)
*Delicious beverages at our delicious beverage bar
*Visuals by Jem & The Holograms ("outrageous!")
*100% FREE unlimited joy!


All responsible ages welcome ::: $10 suggested donation :::: 10pm until late
:::: Limited Capacity!

Located in Alameda, not far from Downtown Oakland.
For more info and directions, stay tuned to www.defsf.com/blissedout

Date: April 4th, 2008

modern works by... !

* MEDIUM REALITY
* ELLE
* WAYNE HANSON

+ Special Guests!

you there!

*Muah*Muah*muah!

X-TRAIN
active life meets night life

as we move into springtime, remember that dancing = cardio, and techno burns calories!
join us for an AIDS/LifeCycle fundraising effort and a chance to meet fellow party people who enjoy an active lifestyle.

each of our DJs this evening will be dropping techy beats and representing their chosen sport:

FOREST GREEN
(ForestGreen.org, Cute Fang Recordings, Cute Things With Fangs, Daly City Recs.)

MEK
(Stilldream, Techno Truth)

MO CORLEONE
(www.aidslifecycle.org/2130)

TATAR
(www.aidslifecycle.org/3258)

Friday, April 4th
Catalyst Cocktails
312 Harriet Street
San Francisco, CA
10:00pm - 2:00am

All door proceeds to benefit AIDS/LifeCycle riders (i'm one of 'em!)
$5 - $10 suggested donation, but everyone is welcome!

skiers, snowboarders, cyclists, runners, and gym rats are especially encouraged to check out the show. find workout buddies, rideshares for tahoe trips, training partners, and more!

see ya there!

*bliss does not require ignorance*

It's 8:15 on the East Coast, going to get to drive through lots of =20
flooding and tornado areas in Tennessee, Arkansas and Oklahoma.  Maybe =20
time to buy a house in Oklahoma and move the SFRaves operations to =20
where houses cost $50,000?  Welp.  Thanks to excellent sources of news =20
I listen to, like Rense.com, Kidd, and Jones, we have today's =20
excellent quote from one of my favorite orators, who is somehow able =20
to duplicate that style in his writing.  Is it possible to actually =20
hear someone's voice as you're reading their book?

--

George Bush has always traded shamelessly on his alleged record as a =20
naval aviator during the Second World War in the Pacific theatre.  =20
During the 1964 Senate campaign in Texas against Ralph Yarborough, =20
Bush televised a grainy old film which depicted young George being =20
rescued at sea by the crew of the submarine USS Finnback after his =20
Avenger torpedo bomber was hit by Japanese anti-aircraft fire during a =20
bombing raid on the island of Chichi Jima on September 2, 1944.  That =20
film, retrieved from the Navy archives, backfired when it was put on =20
the air too many times, eventually becoming something of a maladroit =20
clich=E9.

- Webster Griffin Tarpley, George Bush:  The Unauthorized Biography, page 10=
1.

Subject: [sfraves] remember when?: Archaic Revival

First, tune in here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8BOUtKe2dg

Then read along...

"we're not dropping out here... we're infiltrating and TAKING OVER."
-- Terrance McKenna

Best,

Peter

Archaic Revival

"Allright... tonight, for your edification and amusement... three raves, two interregnums. Visions by Rose X. Didgeredoo, Stephen Kent. And sound by Space Time. Words and ideas by Terence McKenna. Rap one: The Archaic Revival.

History is ending, because the dominator culture has led the human species into a blind alley. And as the inevitable chaostrophe approaches, people look for metaphors and answers. Every time a culture gets into trouble, it casts itself back into the past looking for the last sane moment it ever knew. And the last sane moment we ever knew was on the plains of Africa, 15,000 years ago, rocked in cradle of the great horned mushroom goddess before history. Before standing armies, before slavery and property, before warfare and phonetic alphabets and monotheism. Before, before, before. And this is where the future is taking us. Because the secret faith of the 20th century is not modernism. The secret faith of the 20th century is nostalgia for the archaic, nostalgia for the Paleolithic, and that gives us body piercing, abstract expressionism, surrealism, jazz, rock and roll, and Catastrophe Theory. The 20th century mind is nostalgic for the paradise that once
 existed on the mushroom-dotted plains of Africa, where the plant-human symbiosis occurred that pulled us out of the animal body and into the tool-using, culture-making, imagination-exploring creature that we are.

And why does this matter? It matters because it chose that the way out is back, and that the future is a forward escape into the past. This is what the psychedelic experience means. Its a doorway out of history and into the wiring under the board in eternity. And I tell you this because if the community understands what it is that holds it together, the community will be better able to streamline itself for flight into hyperspace. Because what we need is a new myth. What we need is a new true story that tells us where were going in the universe. And that true story is that the ego is a product of pathology and that when psilocybin is regularly part of the human experience, the ego is suppressed. And the suppression of the ego means the defeat of the dominators, the materialists, the product peddlers. Psychedelics return us to the inner worth of the self, to the importance of feeling immediate experience. And nobody can sell that to you and nobody can buy
 it from you, so the dominator culture is not interested in the felt presence of immediate experience. But thats what holds the community together. And as we break out of the silly myths of science and the infantile obsessions of the marketplace, what we discover through the psychedelic experience is that in the body-- in the body-- there are Niagara of beauty, alien beauty, alien dimensions that are part of the self, the richest part of life.

I think of going to the grave without having a psychedelic experience, like going to the grave without having sex. It means that you never figured out what it was all about. The mystery is in the body, and the way the body works itself into nature. What the archaic revival means is shamanism, ecstasy, orgiastic sexuality, and the defeat of the three enemies of the people, and the three enemies of the people are hegemony, monogamy, and monotony. And if you get them on the run, you have the dominators sweating, folks. Because that means that youre getting it all reconnected, and get it all reconnected means putting aside the idea of separateness and self-definition through thing fetish. Getting it all connected means tapping into the Gaian mind. And the Gaian mind is what were calling the psychedelic experience. Its an experience of the living fact of the entelechy of the planet, and without that experience we wander in a desert of bogus ideologies, but
 with that experience, the compass of the self can be set. And thats the idea, that were figuring out how to reset the compass of the self, through community, through ecstatic dance, through psychedelics, intelligence-- intelligence... this is what we have to have to make the forward escape into hyperspace."

--Terrance McKenna

> On Apr 4, 2008, at 7:12 AM, dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote:

>> First, tune in here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8BOUtKe2dg
>>
>> Then read along...
>>
>> "we're not dropping out here... we're infiltrating and TAKING OVER."
>> -- Terrance McKenna
>>
>> Best,
>>
>> Peter
>>
>> Archaic Revival
>>
>> "Allright... tonight, for your edification and amusement... three  
>> raves, two interregnums. Visions by Rose X. Didgeredoo, Stephen  
>> Kent. And sound by Space Time. Words and ideas by Terence McKenna.  
>> Rap one: The Archaic Revival.
>>
>> History is ending, because the dominator culture has led the human  
>> species into a blind alley. And as the inevitable chaostrophe  
>> approaches, people look for metaphors and answers. Every time a  
>> culture gets into trouble, it casts itself back into the past  
>> looking for the last sane moment it ever knew. And the last sane  
>> moment we ever knew was on the plains of Africa, 15,000 years ago,  
>> rocked in cradle of the great horned mushroom goddess before  
>> history. Before standing armies, before slavery and property, before  
>> warfare and phonetic alphabets and monotheism. Before, before,  
>> before. And this is where the future is taking us. Because the  
>> secret faith of the 20th century is not modernism. The secret faith  
>> of the 20th century is nostalgia for the archaic, nostalgia for the  
>> Paleolithic, and that gives us body piercing, abstract  
>> expressionism, surrealism, jazz, rock and roll, and Catastrophe  
>> Theory. The 20th century mind is nostalgic for the paradise that once
>> existed on the mushroom-dotted plains of Africa, where the plant- 
>> human symbiosis occurred that pulled us out of the animal body and  
>> into the tool-using, culture-making, imagination-exploring creature  
>> that we are.
>>
>> And why does this matter? It matters because it chose that the way  
>> out is back, and that the future is a forward escape into the past.  
>> This is what the psychedelic experience means. Its a doorway out of  
>> history and into the wiring under the board in eternity. And I tell  
>> you this because if the community understands what it is that holds  
>> it together, the community will be better able to streamline itself  
>> for flight into hyperspace. Because what we need is a new myth. What  
>> we need is a new true story that tells us where were going in the  
>> universe. And that true story is that the ego is a product of  
>> pathology and that when psilocybin is regularly part of the human  
>> experience, the ego is suppressed. And the suppression of the ego  
>> means the defeat of the dominators, the materialists, the product  
>> peddlers. Psychedelics return us to the inner worth of the self, to  
>> the importance of feeling immediate experience. And nobody can sell  
>> that to you and nobody can buy
>> it from you, so the dominator culture is not interested in the felt  
>> presence of immediate experience. But thats what holds the community  
>> together. And as we break out of the silly myths of science and the  
>> infantile obsessions of the marketplace, what we discover through  
>> the psychedelic experience is that in the body-- in the body-- there  
>> are Niagara of beauty, alien beauty, alien dimensions that are part  
>> of the self, the richest part of life.
>>
>> I think of going to the grave without having a psychedelic  
>> experience, like going to the grave without having sex. It means  
>> that you never figured out what it was all about. The mystery is in  
>> the body, and the way the body works itself into nature. What the  
>> archaic revival means is shamanism, ecstasy, orgiastic sexuality,  
>> and the defeat of the three enemies of the people, and the three  
>> enemies of the people are hegemony, monogamy, and monotony. And if  
>> you get them on the run, you have the dominators sweating, folks.  
>> Because that means that youre getting it all reconnected, and get it  
>> all reconnected means putting aside the idea of separateness and  
>> self-definition through thing fetish. Getting it all connected means  
>> tapping into the Gaian mind. And the Gaian mind is what were calling  
>> the psychedelic experience. Its an experience of the living fact of  
>> the entelechy of the planet, and without that experience we wander  
>> in a desert of bogus ideologies, but
>> with that experience, the compass of the self can be set. And thats  
>> the idea, that were figuring out how to reset the compass of the  
>> self, through community, through ecstatic dance, through  
>> psychedelics, intelligence-- intelligence... this is what we have to  
>> have to make the forward escape into hyperspace."
>>
>> --Terrance McKenna

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Permaculture Bike Tour this Sunday

--Apple-Mail-16--762251322
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	format=flowed;
	delsp=yes
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hey everyone,

The East Bay Permaculture Guild is having it's annual Garden Bike Tour  
this Sunday, starting at 11:30 at the North Berkeley BART station. We  
cruise around as a group, checking out some pretty spectacular gardens.

If you're into gardening (or want to learn) this is a great  
opportunity to get some ideas and inspiration and see what others are  
doing with their yards and community spaces.

Let me know if you have any questions about the tour or if you'd like  
to come. We ask for a $10 donation to the Permaculture Guild, but  
nobody will be turned away for lack of money.

The past two years have had groups of about 25 to 30 people on the  
tour. It's loads of fun. Hope you can join us!

-Philip-


Here's the tour itinerary:

For a bird's eye view of the route on Google maps: http://TinyURL.com/yqkvgy

You are welcome to join us for any part of the tour, but please do not
arrive at any of the sites when we are not scheduled to be there.  
thanks.


11:30 Meet at North Berkeley BART Station - 1750 Sacramento St, Berkeley
www.bart.gov - We'll meet in front of the main entrance.

12:00 - 12:20 - Private backyard - 2111 7th St.
Sheetmulched by the East Bay Permaculture Guild last year, planted  
with trees and annual veggies.

12:30 - 12:55 - Berkeley Youth Alernatives garden - Bancroft Way  
between West and Bonar
After school program, perennials and annuals, community volunteers. -
www.byaonline.org

1:00 - 1:30 - Backyard by Earthly Arts - Mabel St and Derby St.
Guest room made from salvaged materials, water catchment, greywater,
chickens and a rabbit - www.earthlyarts.com

1:45 - 2:15 - Fort Awesome - 3090 and 3088 King St.
2 houses owned by the non-profit Cooperative Roots, garden, solar
electric and hot water, chickens - cooperativeroots.org

2:15 - 3:05 - Snack Break at Fort Awesome
Rest and munch on lite snacks from Food Not Bombs.  Optional tour of
garden on Sacramento - www.ebfnb.org

3:15 - 3:45 - Christopher Shein's home - 1526 Fairview St
Straw bale office space, bamboo chicken coop and shower, intensive
garden, nursery, greywater - www.wildheartgardens.com -
www.merrittlandhort.com

4:05 - 4:45 - Mariposa Grove - 828 59th St, Emeryville
Cohousing community with garden, chickens, 3 buildings contain
apartments and shared space. - healthyarts.com/mariposagrove

5:00 - 5:30 - Halcyon Commons - Between Webster & Prince St on Halcyon  
Ct
Community designed and initiated park dedicated in '96 after 4 years
of community involvement. - www.bpfp.org/affiliate-groups/Halcyon
--Apple-Mail-16--762251322--

Yeah, so the EB 4 year anniversary was the fucking shit. Saw loads of folks
I hadn't seen in ages. Everyone played dope sets, but especially Chris
Carter and RedStickMan's closing set was fucking sick.

AND IT WAS FREE!

If you didn't go, not only should you feel awful about yourself for being a
lousy excuse for a human being, but you should also apologize to the list
publicly.

It was that fucking good.

So thanks to Evil Breaks for throwing bangin parties for the last 4 years,
but especially for the serious business that went down last night.

Srsly u guise. U guise. Srsly.

Subject: [sfraves] WR: Evil Breaks 4 Yr Yummy!!!!!  YAAAY

OK.. i know i have to play catch up here & post up all my like WRs I ain't
had time to really post up.. so I figure I'll start backwards & work my
way up to the WR I left off @...

Friday night I was a huuuuuuuuge well.. Friday day I was a huuuge lazy ass
& I staarted liike cleaning my pad up 'cause i kinda let it get messy the
past few weeks my parents been gone.. so by days end of cleaning & after
dinner, i was on the sofa watching Muppets Take Manhatten (which i ainh't
seen in years)... I mean... I seriously underestimated how long cleaning
was gonna take 'cause i was suppose to be in the City already doing
something, but no bueno... so basically, so set up, no go out!!  I thought
I was pretty much assed out at that point.

So while I'm watching Muppets... Unka calls me & demands that I go with
her to Evil Breaks... I mean.. homegirl was insistant on me going... &
well... she picked up my fat ass in Hercules & like seriously took me out
& Wow.. lol.. Hello 2day... I was sooo like Wow!!!  I mean.. she came
through & hooked a brutha up!!  She hella worked me on the phone for a
good almost 20 minutes for me to get out & it worked!!!!

OK... so we got there... 1st thing I gotta say is that the vibe was sooo
fuckin' huuuge!!!  So many people in Good Spirits, Good Energy, Good
people!!!  I mean... it's rare for me to go to a club & get all the ravey
vibe like that, but it happened!!!  The whole night wqas filled w/ people
I Love & Wow.. so Dope!!!

Music was Sick... I mean.. there was always a problem with where to dance
'cause all 3 areas were fuckin' Ill!!!  Yeah... Chris Carter killed it,
totally.. but like the EB crew totally made me ooh man.. it was so hard
not to dance!!!  I will say Bam's set was sooo like the set for me that
night!!!  I mean.. he killed it the week b4 @ Phoenix & maybe this set was
a continuation of that DJ energy he's been harnising & shining out.. but
yeah... I hella was in awe!!!

Oh yeah.. i got a massage & kinda reiki that night too!! :)  That was
pretty sick!!

But yeah... I mean... the whole week I was kinda 1/2 n 1/2 w/ my
emotions... I was still like hella high from Phoenix & hella mondo fuckin'
afterglowin' after that, but @ the same time, I was kinda goin' through
some rough kinda personal issues & I was just head fucked... but Unka,
Girl.. Thank U so much for getting me outta my funk & helpin' me get my
head strait again!!!

I totally needed Friday night so bad!!!  Evil Breaks was oooo intense.. if
you were there, u know what i'm talkin' about!!!  Thanks Evil Breaks for 4
years of madness & good times!!!


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Mo,

Great NRR topic!

I'm torn on the issue. I mean, I totally support Tibet, and I'm happy the issue of China's occupation is still getting global attention. On the other hand, look at what's happened in past Olympics. It seems like when they're held in controversial settings, (i.e. Nazi Germany, Russia) important things happen that set a turning point in history. I won't get into the whole civil rights impact spiel (right now, maybe later), but I think we can all agree that there have been significant turning points in history that occurred in Olympic venues.

IMHO, if China does get to host the Olympics, and that they get their asses collectively whooped, I think that would make a stronger statement then the current protests.

That said, I'd be very interested to read some other perspectives.

peace

CKG



mo corleone <mo_corleone2@yahoo.com> wrote: it looks like the olympic torch has met some challenges so far in london and paris. san francisco will be the only north american stop on the torch's journey, and it appears there is trouble brewing here as well. thoughts? is anyone planning to join the protests this wednesday?

--0-2044170610-1207599237=:99055
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

i can't really tell what's going on in that link... it looks like a reporter standing around waiting to share some breaking news that hasn't occurred yet. they zoomed in to something that might have been a sign hanging from the bridge...?

oh wait... it looks like some students climbed up the bridge, hung a banner, and are now being arrested. here's a fresh link to the story: http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gk8PeY1hcZPUKEORn6FeB95CGbyw

at any rate, i'm thinking about joining this protest. the olympics aren't particularly meaningful to me, but it's not every day that we get a chance to focus on human rights violations in front of an international audience and say "this is not acceptable". the issue of tibet especially is one that seems to pass in and out of the spotlight, and i think it's worthwhile to remind people that these problems have still yet to be resolved. 

i need to work too, but the torch route passes quite close to my office so i'm leaning towards skipping out for a bit. if the group is large, the press (in china or elsewhere) will have more difficulty dismissing the opposition as "a tiny number of Tibet independence elements". it seems to run a lot deeper than that, and the sentiment is ringing out across the globe. i don't start a lot of nrr topics on this list, but i'm definitely curious to hear what the (often politically charged) sfravers have to say. it does seem to be a topic that deserves further examination. 

love,
mo

dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote: There are apparently some guys up ont the GG bridge right now protesting.  Here's the live video feed:  http://www.nbc11.com/videostream/11441536/detail.html

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: 2008 olympic torch relay


On Mon, 7 Apr 2008, mo corleone wrote:
-&e->it looks like the olympic torch has met some challenges so far in 
-&e->london and paris. san francisco will be the only north american stop 
-&e->on the torch's journey, and it appears there is trouble brewing here 
-&e->as well. thoughts? is anyone planning to join the protests this 
-&e->wednesday?
-&e->
-&e->*bliss does not require ignorance*

And another way of looking at it...

Politicizing the Olympics while we type from our computers that were made 
in China is pretty damn pointless.  If we're boycotting, let's hit em 
where it hurts (the pocketbook, favored trade nation status, etc), not 
where they pointlessely lose face.  Fact is when you take BART into 
Oakland and pass miles of stacked shipping containers, almost every one of 
those empty containers is made in China, filled with Chinese goods for 
sale here, and left to rot at Port of Oakland because they don't want what 
we make as much as we want what they make.

The Olympics, while a demonstration from representatives of nations are 
one of the greatest exercises of humanism in modern times.  We didn't rob 
Jesse Owens his records by boycotting the Berlin games (even while 
Hitler's cries of "aryan master race" were echoing through the country), 
and I think a lot of the politicizing of the torch route is in a similar 
vein.

The PROC's human rights record is despicable, but I wish there was a 
better way of demonstrating our lack of approval of it.  Well, there are, 
but I'm not sure we're willing to pay the price.  China's behavior in 
regards to Sudan and Tibet *should* be on everybody's minds (as should our 
own government's support of similar regimes), but chiseling away at one of 
the things that I really think gives people hope at a basic human level 
isn't fair, especially to those olympians who experience only one or two 
olympics in the physical prime of their lives.

My swimming instructor when I was a kid was dicked out of a chance to 
prove her skills, gifts and training to the rest of the world when the US 
boycotted the Moscow olympics over their occupation of Afghanistan (and 
um, quick reality check, we're currently actively militarily occupying at 
least 2 nations as we speak including... oh look, Afghanistan).  Sucks, 
she was on the US team, she had the times to place if not win.

The torch and the games are a symbol of unity, of humankind coming 
together on the fairest of grounds to compete under the flags of all 
nations.  The error of having China host it was made years ago, I think 
politicizing the torch run and talk of further polticizing it is cheap and 
opportunist cause people don't want to put in the real work and skip on 
buying products from Apple, Ikea, Walmart, Target, Behringer, Mackie, 
Huffy, Keds, Timberland, RCA, etc, etc, etc.  It has reached the point now 
that it is easier to figure out who doesn't use Chinese factories.  
Almost every cell phone battery/laptop battery/ipod battery, etc you can 
get is made in substandard condition Chinese plants... despite China 
actually having some fairly strict worker protection laws (they just 
aren't enforced and moves to demand that companies get in on the 
enforcement game have been less than wholly successful).  The real enemy 
here is American consumers supporting American companies without adequate 
oversight.  We get our shit, companies get fat and happy, Chinese 
government and companies get their money, and the cycle is complete.  It 
seems we're very happy supporting China.  Despite what it does to it's own 
people, in all it's prefectures.  Despite what it does in other countries.

http://www.chinahighlights.com/tibet/map.htm

Tibet should be free, but on the other hand it's FUCKING HUGE (a great 
many people seem to think Tibet is some small mountain county full of 
goatherders and monks who just get beat up peacefully protesting while 
going to temple and chanting), and in a geopolitically un-negotiable 
location for China to tolerate a "western" thinking country.  On the other 
hand, our renewed interest in it has primarily to do with recent nuclear 
accords with India.  In short, we're getting played in a bigger game.  
The plight of Tibet has not changed, but the landscape is changing.  Do I 
support free Tibet?  Sure.  Is it viable?  Maybe not.  But a HUGE first 
step would be insisting that if China wishes to maintain most favored 
trade nation status with the nation most sucking it's mighty wang, they 
must allow free travel and free speech of international inspectors of 
working conditions in their factories, free speech in general from the 
populace, and accountability at a government level for serious infractions 
to those agreements.

I'd almost be happier if the torch went everywhere, might get people 
thinking.  It's a lot better than having to face the fact that while 
you're waiting for the other protesters, you might want to read the back 
of your ipod, the bottom bracket of your bicycle or the back of the helmet 
you're wearing and see where it was made.  Voting with our wallets, and 
pushing a greater degree of corporate & government accountability seem to 
me to be more effective than telling a symbol of global union, peaceful 
competition and humanism where it can't go.

http://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/report/what-human-rights-legacy-beijing-olympics-20080401
http://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/news/afghanistan-arms-fuel-further-abuse-20080403
http://www.abc.net.au/7.30/content/2007/s2209892.htm

Muscling the torch from pretty much innocent photo opp runners that are 
just stoked to play a part in a tradition that stems back to ancient 
greece, trying to hit it with a fire extinguisher?  Who is fucking bully 
here?  I suppose it's easy to do if you see the torch as a symbol of 
China's occupation of Tibet or continued civil rights record, but before 
you get too kooky, understand that's not how a lot of the world sees it.

Some good points.  But protesting isn't the same as a boycott of the games by the athletes.  

Tthere is now talk of a broadcast boycott at least in some countries.  See http://blogs.guardian.co.uk/greenslade/2008/04/journalists_and_political_lead.html and http://followthemedia.com/writeon/boycott06042008.htm

I guess its also worth noting that the Chinese have already been paid for the broadcast rights, and watching or not watching probably won't imapct that at all.  You' just be boycotting NBC (http://www.reuters.com/article/reutersComService_2_MOLT/idUSN0719871120080407)  in reality.  Of course if the Chinese don't even allow a live broadcast (see http://news.sky.com/skynews/article/0,,30000-1310416,00.html) the point may be moot.

Peter

----- Original Message ----
From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
To: mo corleone <mo_corleone2@yahoo.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Monday, April 7, 2008 1:19:44 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: 2008 olympic torch relay


On Mon, 7 Apr 2008, mo corleone wrote:
-&e->it looks like the olympic torch has met some challenges so far in 
-&e->london and paris. san francisco will be the only north american stop 
-&e->on the torch's journey, and it appears there is trouble brewing here 
-&e->as well. thoughts? is anyone planning to join the protests this 
-&e->wednesday?
-&e->
-&e->*bliss does not require ignorance*

And another way of looking at it...

Politicizing the Olympics while we type from our computers that were made 
in China is pretty damn pointless.  If we're boycotting, let's hit em 
where it hurts (the pocketbook, favored trade nation status, etc), not 
where they pointlessely lose face.  Fact is when you take BART into 
Oakland and pass miles of stacked shipping containers, almost every one of 
those empty containers is made in China, filled with Chinese goods for 
sale here, and left to rot at Port of Oakland because they don't want what 
we make as much as we want what they make.

The Olympics, while a demonstration from representatives of nations are 
one of the greatest exercises of humanism in modern times.  We didn't rob 
Jesse Owens his records by boycotting the Berlin games (even while 
Hitler's cries of "aryan master race" were echoing through the country), 
and I think a lot of the politicizing of the torch route is in a similar 
vein.

The PROC's human rights record is despicable, but I wish there was a 
better way of demonstrating our lack of approval of it.  Well, there are, 
but I'm not sure we're willing to pay the price.  China's behavior in 
regards to Sudan and Tibet *should* be on everybody's minds (as should our 
own government's support of similar regimes), but chiseling away at one of 
the things that I really think gives people hope at a basic human level 
isn't fair, especially to those olympians who experience only one or two 
olympics in the physical prime of their lives.

My swimming instructor when I was a kid was dicked out of a chance to 
prove her skills, gifts and training to the rest of the world when the US 
boycotted the Moscow olympics over their occupation of Afghanistan (and 
um, quick reality check, we're currently actively militarily occupying at 
least 2 nations as we speak including... oh look, Afghanistan).  Sucks, 
she was on the US team, she had the times to place if not win.

The torch and the games are a symbol of unity, of humankind coming 
together on the fairest of grounds to compete under the flags of all 
nations.  The error of having China host it was made years ago, I think 
politicizing the torch run and talk of further polticizing it is cheap and 
opportunist cause people don't want to put in the real work and skip on 
buying products from Apple, Ikea, Walmart, Target, Behringer, Mackie, 
Huffy, Keds, Timberland, RCA, etc, etc, etc.  It has reached the point now 
that it is easier to figure out who doesn't use Chinese factories.  
Almost every cell phone battery/laptop battery/ipod battery, etc you can 
get is made in substandard condition Chinese plants... despite China 
actually having some fairly strict worker protection laws (they just 
aren't enforced and moves to demand that companies get in on the 
enforcement game have been less than wholly successful).  The real enemy 
here is American consumers supporting American companies without adequate 
oversight.  We get our shit, companies get fat and happy, Chinese 
government and companies get their money, and the cycle is complete.  It 
seems we're very happy supporting China.  Despite what it does to it's own 
people, in all it's prefectures.  Despite what it does in other countries.

http://www.chinahighlights.com/tibet/map.htm

Tibet should be free, but on the other hand it's FUCKING HUGE (a great 
many people seem to think Tibet is some small mountain county full of 
goatherders and monks who just get beat up peacefully protesting while 
going to temple and chanting), and in a geopolitically un-negotiable 
location for China to tolerate a "western" thinking country.  On the other 
hand, our renewed interest in it has primarily to do with recent nuclear 
accords with India.  In short, we're getting played in a bigger game.  
The plight of Tibet has not changed, but the landscape is changing.  Do I 
support free Tibet?  Sure.  Is it viable?  Maybe not.  But a HUGE first 
step would be insisting that if China wishes to maintain most favored 
trade nation status with the nation most sucking it's mighty wang, they 
must allow free travel and free speech of international inspectors of 
working conditions in their factories, free speech in general from the 
populace, and accountability at a government level for serious infractions 
to those agreements.

I'd almost be happier if the torch went everywhere, might get people 
thinking.  It's a lot better than having to face the fact that while 
you're waiting for the other protesters, you might want to read the back 
of your ipod, the bottom bracket of your bicycle or the back of the helmet 
you're wearing and see where it was made.  Voting with our wallets, and 
pushing a greater degree of corporate & government accountability seem to 
me to be more effective than telling a symbol of global union, peaceful 
competition and humanism where it can't go.

http://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/report/what-human-rights-legacy-beijing-olympics-20080401
http://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/news/afghanistan-arms-fuel-further-abuse-20080403
http://www.abc.net.au/7.30/content/2007/s2209892.htm

Muscling the torch from pretty much innocent photo opp runners that are 
just stoked to play a part in a tradition that stems back to ancient 
greece, trying to hit it with a fire extinguisher?  Who is fucking bully 
here?  I suppose it's easy to do if you see the torch as a symbol of 
China's occupation of Tibet or continued civil rights record, but before 
you get too kooky, understand that's not how a lot of the world sees it.

andyw - mutorsoundsystem - saturn5.com/andy

And um... hey buddy, the Olympics are way rave related.  I usually show up 
at the front door of a party, and I'm thinking "Citius, Altius, Fortius".  
That is totally like meth, peyote and viagra[*].  Which is how I roll.

FERREAL.
andyw

* MethPeyoteViagra has not been evaluated by the FDA (as a whole, like, 
officially... although some people a friend of mine knows that work at the 
FDA have tried it but that's neither here nor there).  Allergic reactions 
have been noted, including shooting Cambodian Death Spiders out your 
peehole, and squirrels being elected to Congress while riding a bicycle 
built for 2 through a wormhole.  If you experience an erection lasting 
more than your birth/rebirth trip, please contact a medicine 
man/woman/whatever you're into you freaky old bastard you.  Do not mix 
with alcohol. Do not mix with itself.  And for the good of the party, 
don't mix records on MethPeyoteViagra.  If a simple little K hole freaks 
you out, MethPeyoteViagra is probably not for you (pussy).  Make sure you 
allow a full 8 hours sleep after coming down from MethPeyoteViagra (which 
may also keep you up for some 95+ hours in the first place).  In extremely 
rare cases, MethPeyoteViagra has not caused hallucinations or dream-like 
states.

e

--

A sacrifice was needed from war workers, the lunch team decided.   
Although earlier that morning DuPont's Dr. A.N. Benning had described  
how 1 part per million of hydrogen flouride in air etched glass in two  
hours, the diners determined that 6 parts per million of flouride  
breathed in factory air would be the wartime flouride standard for an  
8-hour workday, six days a week.

- Chris Bryson, "The Flouride Deception", page 82.

Tank'd!


Group: Staff
Posts: 1,701
Joined: 14-March 07

Member No.: 34



It's about time I came on here and thank the lot of you after your well
wishes for both the good times we shared at Moksha as well as following
my sickness/surgery last week after the Moksha party.  After the fact,
it turned out I wasn't as bad off as I could have been on account my
stubborn ass got into see the doc relatively early and since the
procedure, I've been feeling absolutely STELLAR!  It's amazing such a
tiny thing in your insides can make you sick for so long only to have
all signs of it go *poof* with the proper treatment, so good news is,
I'm 100% percent and won't have to postpone any of the engagements I had
lined up before the shit went down.  With all that said, I figured I may
as well give y'all a heads up on something I'll be coming down to your
neck of the woods to partake in.  I'm on from midnight - 1am or so, so
if you have the time and energy, then feel free to get your fix and kick
it with me whilst we chat the hell up about a bunch of who-knows-what...
or just come and dance and the hell with chatting!


------------------------------------------------------------------------

This Thursday, April 10th 2008

Trauma @ El Rincon presents:
SPRUNG! - a Springtime celebration!

Featuring the tech-nasty audiotistic manipulating styles of: 

Dragn'fly (DJDragnFly.com, DJ4NORML) 
Dirt (Cymbalic / Omniscient Records)
5-MeO (acidtotem.net / 5-meo-techno.com)
and
Reclipse (Trauma/Tank'd/Norcal Nights)

FOOD & DRINK SPECIALS ALL NIGHT LONG!!!

located @..... 
EL RINCON 
2700 16TH STREET {@ Harrison) 
San Francisco, CA 
10PM-2AM

April 09, 2008

    Matthew Dear, who was celebrating his birthday yesterday, had been
playing a killer set for 2 hours or so. Suddenly he got a message on
his computer saying that his hard disk drive was unplugged.

actually missing - basically someone STOLE his hard drive in the middle
of his set and ruined the all show!!!

Didn't take no chances
I was a pris'ner of doubt.
I knocked down the wailin' wall
Ain't no sin
Got the feel of fortune; deal me in

Comin' straight on for you. You made my mind.
Now I'm stronger. Now I'm comin' through
Straight on, straight on for you
Straight on for you.

Now I know I got to play my hand
What the winner don't know, a gambler understands
My heart keeps playin' it through
with you, my friend
I'll take my chances on you again and again...again.

Comin' straight on for you. You made my mind
Now I'm stronger. Now I'm comin' through
Straight on, straight on for you
Straight on for you

Repeat

- Heart, Straight On

Hi Jim,

Actually a 2-DVD set of the documentary was released a couple of years ago.
A friend in NYC, Barry Lederer, one of the original GLF Firehouse DJs and
designer of the Trocs soundsystem among others, sent it to me.

Problem is there is so very little footage from the seventies.  The PG video
is from the closing parties in '87 as I recall.  By that time half of the
seventies staff and dancers were dead.

Ah well, good times.

Love,

Apollo

Come party with us at the Bliss Factory tomorrow night!  Alameda may be an
island, but it's not that far away, honestly. We're a 10 minute drive from
the Bay Bridge and 5 minutes from Downtown Oakland.  Joy, fun, and extremely
loud throbbing music 100% guaranteed. Timeslots are as follows:

10-11 Toro Toro
11-11:30 Easystreet (live)
11:30-12:30 Caltrop
12:30-1:30 Forest Green
1:30-2:30 Alex Windsor
2:30-3:30 Razvan
3:30-4:30 Andy W (live)
4:30-? Disconnect

More info below, or at www.defsf.com/blissedout ... See you tomorrow night!

Love Chelsea


....::::Friday, April 11th, 2008::::....

*Blissed Out* ::: A Benefit party for Bliss Factory Studios!

Bliss Factory Studios in Alameda is homebase for DEF, Radio Integrated,
Easystreet, Chel-C Faith and Sean Ocean. Help us raise some funds to save
the B.Fact in the most fun way possible... partying, of course!

Featuring music from our wonderful friends:

Alex Windsor (Friends & Family) :::: Techno
Andy W (Resource Records, Friends & Family) :::: Techno - *All Hardware Live
P.A.*
Caltrop (Tokyo Electric) :::: Acid House/Disco
Disconnect (DEF, Bliss Factory) :::: Techno
Easystreet (myspace.com/sexyeasystreet<http://www.myspace.com/sexyeasystreet>)
:::: Italo Disco/Electro Pop - *Live*
Forest Green (ForestGreen.org <http://www.forestgreen.org/>, Daly City
Records, Cute Fang Recordings) :::: Techno
Razvan (Black Market Techno) :::: Techno/Minimal
Toro Toro (Friends & Family) :::: Tech-House

 Plus....

*Bake Sale by Miss Chelsea Faith
*Raver Garage Sale (so don't forget to tuck a few extra dollars in the stash
pocket of your UFOs!)
*Delicious beverages at our delicious beverage bar
*Visuals by Jem & The Holograms ("outrageous!")
*100% FREE unlimited joy!

All responsible ages welcome ::: $10 suggested donation :::: 10pm until late
:::: Limited Capacity!

Located in Alameda, not far from Downtown Oakland. For directions, stay
tuned to www.defsf.com/blissedout

    Matthew Dear, who was celebrating his birthday yesterday, had been
playing a killer set for 2 hours or so. Suddenly he got a message on
his computer saying that his hard disk drive was unplugged.

actually missing - basically someone STOLE his hard drive in the middle
of his set and ruined the all show!!!
